intro: Thesium himalense, commonly known as the Himalayan thesium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae. It is native to the alpine regions of the Himalayas, where it thrives in cold and moist environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, often at elevations above 3,000 meters. Thesium himalense plays a role in the ecological balance of its habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to soil stability.
